titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Upcott, Original Letters
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:57
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: "Original letters collected by William Upcott of the London Institution Dukes and Marquesses. First series."

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Autograph MSS.
Letters mounted in an album.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn d194 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Upcott, Original Letters. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn d194. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

did.unittitle: Osborn d194
ABERCORN, ANNA JANE HAMILTON, MARCHIONESS OF, 1763-1827
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Concerns a bill.
d 194/69

did.unittitle: ABERCORN, ANNA JANE HAMILTON, MARCHIONESS OF, 1763-1827
ALS to [Edward?] Evans (1789-1835)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 25 x 20 cm.
Requests the price of the "Travels
of India" by William Hodges, R.A.
(1744-1797).
d 194/70

did.unittitle: ARGYLL, GEORGE WILLIAM CAMPBELL, 6TH DUKE OF, 1768-1839
AL (in third person) to Mr. Hanley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Desires five proofs of the portrait
print of Lord Frederick Campbell
(1782-1846).
d 194/1

did.unittitle: ATHOLL, MARGERY (FORBES) MURRAY, DUCHESS OF, D. 1842
AL (in third person) to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Dunkeld
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Order for a dress and fabric.
d 194/2

did.unittitle: BATH, THOMAS THYNNE, MARQUESS OF, 1765-1837
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grovesnor Square
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Accepts the Vice Presidency of the
Vaccine Institution.
d 194/72

did.unittitle: BEAUFORT, CHARLOTTE SOPHIA SOMERSET, DUCHESS OF, 1771-1854
AL (in third person) to Dr. Wingfield

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Badminton
1 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Would like more attention from him.
d 194/3

did.unittitle: BEAUFORT, CHARLOTTE SOPHIA SOMERSET, DUCHESS OF, 1771-1854
AL (in third person) to Henry Colburn (d. 1855)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Whichwood Park
1 p.; 17 x 12 cm.
Places book orders.
d 194/4

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, GEORGIANA ELIZABETH RUSSELL, DUCHESS OF, D. 1801
AL (in third person) to Mr. Edwards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Stratton Park
1 p.; 25 x 20 cm.
Places an order.
d 194/7

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, GEORGIANA ELIZABETH RUSSELL, DUCHESS OF, D. 1801
AL to Mrs. Plowman, draper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Woburn Abbey
1 p.; 22 x 19 cm.
Orders fabric.
d 194/11

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, JOHN RUSSELL, 6TH DUKE OF, 1766-1839
AL (in third person) to Boydell and Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Stratton Park
1 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
Orders the subscription prints of the
Shakespeare Gallery by John Boydell
(1719-1804).
d 194/6

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, JOHN RUSSELL, 6TH DUKE OF, 1766-1839
LS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Woburn Abbey
2 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Thanks him for his shipment of
"Oriental Scenery" and asks for the
account balance.
d 194/8

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, JOHN RUSSELL, 6TH DUKE OF, 1766-1839
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Woburn Abbey
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Thanks for the notification of a
change of address.
d 194/9

did.unittitle: BEDFORD, JOHN RUSSELL, 6TH DUKE OF, 1766-1839
ALS to Mr. Jeffrey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
2 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Asks for books to be sent to Woburn
Abbey.
d 194/10

did.unittitle: BOLTON, HARRY PAULET, 6TH DUKE OF, 1719-1794
AL to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Hackwood
1 p.; 25 x 19 cm.
Places an order for books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Richmond
1 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
Places an order for books.

did.unittitle: CORNWALLIS, LOUISA CORNWALLIS, MARCHIONESS, 1776-1850
AL to John Walker (1759-1830)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Culford
1 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Requests that the vaccine virus be
sent for a large family surrounded by
smallpox.
d 194/75

did.unittitle: DONEGALL, ANNA (MAY) CHICHESTER, MARCHIONESS OF, D. 1849
AL (in third person) to Henry Colburn (d. 1855)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.; 19 x 12 cm.
Orders books.
d 194/80

did.unittitle: DONEGALL, ARTHUR CHICHESTER, MARQUIS OF, 1739-1799
AL to the [Lord Mayor of London?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
St. James Square
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Makes an appointment.
d 194/79

did.unittitle: DORSET, JOHN FREDERICK SACKVILLE, 3RD DUKE OF, 1745-1799
AL to the Hon. Mrs. Percy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Knole
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Asks permission for the painter
Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810) to copy
the drawing of the portrait of
"Sacharissa" by Sir Anthony Van Dyke
(1599-1641) in her collection.
d 194/21

did.unittitle: DORSET, JOHN FREDERICK SACKVILLE, 3RD DUKE OF, 1745-1799
AL to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Knole
1 p.; 20 x 16 cm.
Makes an appointment with the
painter.
d 194/22

did.unittitle: EXETER, CECIL BROWNLOW, 9TH EARL OF, 1725-1793
2 ALS to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1773 Oct 8 and Dec 19
n.p.
2 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
About two paintings, one presumably
a portrait, and their delivery.
d 194/85-6

did.unittitle: EXETER, CECIL BROWNLOW, 9TH EARL OF, 1725-1793
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Lord Exeter's concerns over the fate
over a painting by Titian which he
fears may go to America.
d 194/87

did.unittitle: EXETER, ELIZABETH ANNE CECIL, MARCHIONESS OF, 1757-1837
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Makes an appointment to sit for him.
d 194/30

did.unittitle: EXETER, ELIZABETH ANNE CECIL, MARCHIONESS OF, 1757-1837
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Apologizes for having forgotten an
appointment.
d 194/31

did.unittitle: EXETER, ELIZABETH ANNE CECIL, MARCHIONESS OF, 1757-1837
AL (in third person) to Mr. Dulau

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
2 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Orders books.
d 194/89

did.unittitle: EXETER, HENRY CECIL, MARQUIS OF, 1754-1804
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[Burghley]
1 p.; 20 x 16 cm.
Sends along a roll of prints and
four books which he suspects may
belong to the recipient.
d 194/88

did.unittitle: GRAFTON, MARY CAROLINE FITZROY, DUCHESS OF, 1795-1873
AL (in third person) to Mr. Abel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Stony Stratford
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Informs him of her imminent
departure and her need to suspend her
subscription.
d 194/29

did.unittitle: HAMILTON, ALEXANDER HAMILTON, 10TH DUKE OF, 1767-1852
AL to Mr. Meyer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Concerns the lettering on two books.

did.unittitle: HAMILTON, SUSAN EUPHEMIA HAMILTON, DUCHESS OF, 1786-1859
AL (in third person) to Mr. Clarke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Hamilton Palace
1 p.; 19 x 12 cm.
Concerns a draft on Hoare and Co.
d 194/83

did.unittitle: HAMILTON, SUSAN EUPHEMIA HAMILTON, DUCHESS OF, 1786-1859
AL (in third person) to Mr. Clarke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 20 x 13 cm.
Requests books in French.
d 194/84

did.unittitle: HERTFORD, FRANCIS SEYMOUR-CONWAY, MARQUIS OF, 1718-1794
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
Assures the recipient of his good
will and faith.
d 194/89x

did.unittitle: LEEDS, GEORGE WILLIAM FREDERICK OSBORNE, DUKE OF, 1775-1838
ALS to Boydell and Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Hornby Castle
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Encloses a receipt of a draft.
d 194/32

did.unittitle: MANCHESTER, WILLIAM MONTAGU, 5TH DUKE OF, 1768-1843
AL (in third person) to Josiah Boydell (1752-1817)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
n.p.
1 p.; 23 x 18 cm.
Subscribes for prints from the
drawings of Giovanni Battista
Cipriani (1727-1785).
d 194/33

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, CAROLINE SPENCER, DUCHESS OF, 1743-1811
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Marlborough House
2 p.; 18 x 14 cm.
Sends a portrait drawing by Thomas
Gainsborough (1727-1788) of her
husband, George Spencer, 4th duke of
Marlborough (1739-1817), and asks
that Humphrey complete, and correct,
the painted portrait from the
drawing (presumably due to
Gainsborough's death).
d 194/35

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, GEORGE SPENCER-CHURCHILL, DUKE OF, 1766-1840
ALS to [Edward?] Evans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
White Knights, Reading
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Requests that he attend the sale of
John Sheldon's library on his behalf.
d 194/36

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, GEORGE SPENCER-CHURCHILL, DUKE OF, 1766-1840
ALS to Mr. Dulau

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
White Knights, Reading
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Requests that books be sent.
d 194/37

did.unittitle: MARLBOROUGH, GEORGE SPENCER-CHURCHILL, DUKE OF, 1766-1840
ALS to Mr. Hayes, bookbinder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
White Knights, Reading
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.
A letter sending instructions.
d 194/38

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grovesnor Square
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Newcastle

did.unittitle: PETTY, LORD WILLIAM
AL (in third person) to B. Penn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Obliged for a letter.
d 194/92

did.unittitle: PORTLAND, MARGARET CAVENDISH BENTINCK, DUCHESS OF, 1715-1785
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Bulstrode
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.

did.unittitle: PORTLAND, WILLIAM HENRY BENTINCK, DUKE OF, 1738-1809
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
1 p.; 13 x 19 cm.

did.unittitle: PORTLAND, WILLIAM HENRY BENTINCK, DUKE OF, 1768-1854
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
1 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Declines the honor of being a Vice
President of the Vaccine Institution.
d 194/51

did.unittitle: PORTLAND, WILLIAM HENRY BENTINCK, DUKE OF, 1768-1854
ALS to Sir Benjamin Thompson, Count Rumford (1753-1814)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
London
2 p.; 18 x 11 cm.
On land he owns at Bulstrode.
d 194/52

did.unittitle: RICHMOND, CHARLES LENNOX, 3RD DUKE OF, 1735-1806
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[London]
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Asks Humphrey to persuade George
Romney (1734-1802) to paint "Mr.
Bentinck" [?William Henry Cavendish
Bentinck, 3rd Duke of Portland
(1738-1809)].
d 194/55

did.unittitle: RICHMOND, CHARLES LENNOX, 3RD DUKE OF, 1735-1806
AL (in third person) to Ozias Humphrey (1742-1810)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Whitehall
2 p.; 22 x 18 cm.
Wishes Henry Singleton (1766-1839)
would overcome his fears and begin
the copy of a painting by Sir
Anthony Van Dyke (1599-1641)
requested by the Duke.
d 194/56

did.unittitle: RICHMOND, CHARLOTTE (GORDON) LENNOX, DUCHESS OF, 1768-1842
AL (in third person) to Robert Plowman and Co., furnishers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Goodwood
Requests information about
furniture; a draft reply by "R.P.
and Co." is appended.
d 194/57

did.unittitle: RUTLAND, ELIZABETH (HOWARD) MANNERS, DUCHESS OF, 1780-1825
AL (in third person) to Kent and Sons, firm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Belvoir Castle
1 p.; 25 x 19 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

n.p.

published.

did.unittitle: TEMPLE, CHANDOS
ALS to an unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Avington
1 p.; 24 x 19 cm.
Requests the newly published
"Travels in Upper and Lower Egypt"

did.unittitle: THOMOND, MARY (PALMER) O'BRIEN, MARCHIONESS OF, 1750-1820
AL (in third person) to William Collom

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Baylis

did.unittitle: WHITWORTH, ARABELLA DIANA WHITWORTH, COUNTESS, 1769-1825

(1723-1792).
